sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Acclaimed author Salman Rushdie is on a ventilator and unable to speak after he was stabbed at an event in New York on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: New details emerge on the FBI's raid of Donald Trump's home, with a search warrant revealing links to the Espionage Act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As shelling continues near Europe's largest power plant, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky insists on Western travel bans for all Russian citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Acclaimed author Salman Rushdie is on a ventilator and unable to speak after being attacked at an event in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The 75-year-old, who received death threats after writing his controversial book The Satanic Verses, was stabbed in the neck on Friday evening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Police raided the house of suspected attacker Hadi Mattar, a 24-year-old man from New Jersey who was arrested at the scene.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Detectives say they're still trying to establish a motive behind the attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I have no idea at this point. Like I said, it's very early. We don't have any indication of a motive at this time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But we are working with the FBI, the Sheriff's Office, and we will determine what the cause of this was or what the motive for this attack was.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Indian-born Rushdie has received praise and criticism for his work, which most notably includes his 1988 novel, which was considered blasphemous by some Muslims due to its references to the Prophet Muhammad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He's since become an advocate for freedom of speech and has defended his work on several occasions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: for freedom of speech and has defended his work on several occasions. FBI agents seized documents labelled as top secret from former US President Donald Trump's

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: home as part of an investigation linked to the Espionage Act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This newly published search warrant reveals that officials removed 11 sets of files from Trump's Mar-a-Lago seaside residence in Florida. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says the retrieval of the documents represents a very serious situation. When we talk about this, there are laws against the improper handling of this material. There are laws against that and we have to recognize that. This information as it is coming across and we'll know more later is highly classified, well above top secret.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Mr. Trump denies any wrongdoing and says the documents were declassified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Among the files was allegedly information about the president of France and an order pardoning Trump's longstanding ally, Roger Stone. Removing classified documents is illegal under the U.S.'s Espionage Act and can carry a five-year prison sentence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Living just kilometres from the Zaporozhye nuclear power station, the largest in Europe, residents of Marganets in Ukraine say they're terrified about military bombardments in the area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The UN warns continued shelling near the plant could, as they put it, lead to disaster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This resident says, We know the result of radiation and what might happen if something goes wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ksenia, a coffee shop vendor, adds, I'm scared for my parents and myself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I want to live and enjoy life in this city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I wish this wasn't happening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: this city. I wish this wasn't happening. It's scary." Meanwhile Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky is doubling down on his calls for Western countries to enforce a travel ban for all Russian citizens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Speaking in his nightly address, Zelensky says, "...we need guarantees that Russian murderers and supporters of state terror won't use the Schengen area it's not acceptable to ruin the very idea of Europe and our common European values it's not possible to turn Europe into a supermarket where anyone can come in and pay for goods visa restrictions for Russian citizens are fair and all defenders of European values should insist on them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin's Russia already faces widespread sanctions from the West. But restrictions do not yet extend to a comprehensive travel ban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Sofia Yezakova is hard at work creating a large-scale drawing that represents the Ukrainian soldiers that have died defending their home country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For a long time, art seemed pointless, but moving into a Ukrainian art collective here in Berlin has helped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For the first two months I couldn't pick up a pencil or a brush, couldn't think about anything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Everything seemed useless and meaningless because the war was on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: People were dying, so what could I possibly draw?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But when I arrived here and for the last two weeks in Ky in Kiev I stopped despairing and I started to draw the art collective called the Ukrainian cultural community has been set up with the help of German organizations 18 Ukrainian artists are living here in a 500 square meter flat that used to be a brothel right in the center of the German capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I think this is a very open metropolis, a city where a lot of cultures interact and also where we have a lot of space, space for people to live, space for people to get support and to meet each other.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Victoria Temnova is from Kherson, a city in the south of Ukraine that is occupied by Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Back home, she was a well-known fashion photographer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Here in Berlin, she is exhibiting photos from the city from before the war to show people the real face of her home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: My city now has another everything.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's still Ukraine, but with no rules, with someone who just wanted to do something violent with your people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Around 70,000 Ukrainian refugees are in Berlin. Each person brings their own story, their own sorrows and their own hopes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Migrants and refugees always bring something to the countries where they do end up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And this is of course no exception.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The artists that have ended up here in the German capital Berlin have brought their own art, their own way of looking at the world to Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This is Jonah Kellgren reporting for Euronews Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A bird's eye view of Austin in the French region of Gironde after a hellish week in which more than 7,400 hectares of forest have burned and at least 10,000 people have been evacuated

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: from their homes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Although they were partially contained during the night, the fires rage on on one of the hottest days of the summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Firefighters from all over Europe have come to the aid of their French colleagues, who are unable to cope with the sheer number of new outbreaks and the re-emergence of fires that had not been completely extinguished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have 1,100 firefighters present, plus an additional 361 personnel and 101 vehicles from European support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They will arrive, some arrived yesterday, like our German and Romanian friends.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And then our Austrian and Polish friends will arrive later today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen took to social media to praise the solidarity of heroic firefighters across the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Plagued by drought and heat waves, this map shows how large swathes of Europe and North Africa are now in extreme danger of catching fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere blazes continue to wreak havoc in parts of Greece, Italy and Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And in Portugal, flames have engulfed the Serra del Estrela Natural Park, causing irreparable damage to a World Heritage Site.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Could this be the scene straight out of an Italian comedy?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A man in Rome had to be rescued after he was buried six meters deep in an illegal tunnel he had dug. Police believe he could have been attempting to rob a bank until things went very, very wrong.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: His rescue required a lot of heavy-duty equipment and hours of manpower.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Understandably, it's the talk of the town.

sentences.sentence: It's like that film, The Down in the Hole Gang.

sentences.sentence: First he risks his life. Second, he has to make a huge effort. Third, he didn't accomplish anything. In the end, if he just stayed seated and did nothing, he would have been better off. In the end, if he just stayed seated and did nothing, he would have been better off." Police say there are two banks within a few hundred meters from the collapsed site.
